page.title:
Comprehensive Risk Adjustment Features and Benefits
Comprehensive Risk Adjustment
Features and Benefits
page.normal_text:
Office of Strategic Planning HCFA, 3/15/00
Office of Strategic Planning
HCFA, 3/15/00
page.enlisting:
• Site-of-service neutral – incentives to hospitalize are minimized • Health status conveys most of the dollars – less weight is applied to demographic factors • Payment accuracy and fairness is improved • overall explained variability • predictive ratios for biased groups • Site-of-service neutral
• Site-of-service neutral
– incentives to hospitalize are minimized • Health status conveys most of the dollars
– incentives to hospitalize are minimized
• Health status conveys most of the dollars
– less weight is applied to demographic factors
– less weight is applied to demographic factors
• Payment accuracy and fairness is improved • overall explained variability • predictive ratios for biased groups
• Payment accuracy and fairness is improved
• overall explained variability
• predictive ratios for biased groups

page.enlisting:

page.title:
Ambulatory Diagnosis Groups - Hospital Dominant (ADG-HOSDOM)
Ambulatory Diagnosis Groups - Hospital
Dominant (ADG-HOSDOM)
page.normal_text:
Office of Strategic Planning HCFA, 3/15/00
Office of Strategic Planning
HCFA, 3/15/00
page.enlisting:
• Diagnoses are grouped into 32 ADGs based on: – duration of the condition(acute, recurrent, or chronic) – severity of the condition (minor/stable vs major/unstable) – diagnostic certainty (symptoms vs documented diseases) – etiology of the condition (infectious, injury, or other) – specialty care involvement (medical, surgical, etc.) • Diagnoses are grouped into 32 ADGs based on:
• Diagnoses are grouped into 32 ADGs based on:
– duration of the condition(acute, recurrent, or chronic) – severity of the condition (minor/stable vs major/unstable) – diagnostic certainty (symptoms vs documented diseases) – etiology of the condition (infectious, injury, or other) – specialty care involvement (medical, surgical, etc.)
– duration of the condition(acute, recurrent, or chronic)
– severity of the condition (minor/stable vs major/unstable)
– diagnostic certainty (symptoms vs documented diseases)
– etiology of the condition (infectious, injury, or other)
– specialty care involvement (medical, surgical, etc.)
• 13 ADGs were selected for the Medicare model • HOSDOM marker is comprised of diagnoses that have at least a 50 % probability of leading to a hospitalization.
• 13 ADGs were selected for the Medicare model
